Package tage.physics

Interface PhysicsObject

All Known Implementing Classes:
JBulletBoxObject, JBulletCapsuleObject, JBulletCapsuleXObject, JBulletCapsuleZObject, JBulletConeObject, JBulletConeXObject, JBulletConeZObject, JBulletCylinderObject, JBulletCylinderXObject, JBulletCylinderZObject, JBulletPhysicsObject, JBulletSphereObject, JBulletStaticPlaneObject
public interface PhysicsObject
If using TAGE, physics objects should be created using the methods in the TAGE Scenegraph class.

  • Method Details

    • getUID

      int getUID()
      Returns the unique ID associated with this IPhysicsObject
      Returns:
      This object's ID

    • setTransform

      void setTransform(double[] transform)
      Sets the transform applied to this IPhysicsObject to the transform represented by the specified array of doubles.
      Parameters:
      transform - An array of 16 doubles representing a 4x4 matrix given in column-major order

    • getTransform

      double[] getTransform()
      Returns a 16-element array of doubles representing the 4x4 transformation matrix for this object
      Returns:
      The transform applied to this object, represented in column-major form

    • getFriction

      float getFriction()
      Returns the friction coefficient associated with this IPhysicsObject
      Returns:
      The object's friction coefficient

    • setFriction

      void setFriction(float friction)
      Sets this IPhysicsObject's coefficient of friction to the specified value.
      Parameters:
      friction - A value between 0 and 1 representing the friction coefficient

    • getBounciness

      float getBounciness()
      Returns the "bounciness" value (also called the restitution constant) associated with this IPhysicsObject.
      Returns:
      A value between 0 and 1 representing the object's bounciness

    • setBounciness

      void setBounciness(float bounciness)
      Sets the bounciness (restitution constant) of this object to the specified value.
      Parameters:
      bounciness - A value between 0 and 1 specifying the object's bounciness

    • getLinearVelocity

      float[] getLinearVelocity()
      Returns a float array giving the [x,y,z] components of this IPhysicsObject's linear velocity.
      Returns:
      The [x,y,z] components of the object's linear velocity

    • setLinearVelocity

      void setLinearVelocity(float[] velocity)
      Sets the linear velocity of this IPhysicsObject to the specified values.
      Parameters:
      velocity - An array of 3 floats specifying the [x,y,z] linear velocity for the object

    • getAngularVelocity

      float[] getAngularVelocity()
      Returns a float array giving the [x,y,z] components of this IPhysicsObject's angular velocity.
      Returns:
      The [x,y,z] components of the object's angular velocity

    • setAngularVelocity

      void setAngularVelocity(float[] velocity)
      Sets the angular velocity of this IPhysicsObject to the specified values.
      Parameters:
      velocity - An array of 3 floats specifying the [x,y,z] angular velocity for the object

    • isDynamic

      boolean isDynamic()
      Returns a flag indicating whether this IPhysicsObject is dynamic or static. Dynamic objects have mass and participate in physics solutions such as collisions.
      Returns:
      Whether this object is dynamic or not

    • setSleepThresholds

      void setSleepThresholds(float linearThreshold, float angularThreshold)
      Sets the sleep threshold for this physics object. The sleep threshold determines at what velocity an object is determined to have come to rest and thus is no longer updated by the physics engine until another object or force affects the object. This can slightly improve performance and help with object having a slight vibrating effect when they should come to rest.
      Parameters:
      linearThreshold -
      angularThreshold -

    • getLinearSleepThreshold

      float getLinearSleepThreshold()
      Returns the linear sleep threshold.
      Returns:
      the linear sleep threshold for this object

    • getAngularSleepThreshold

      float getAngularSleepThreshold()
      Returns the angular sleep threshold.
      Returns:
      the angular sleep threshold for this object

    • setDamping

      void setDamping(float linearDamping, float angularDamping)
      Sets the damping for this physics object. The damping effectively applies an opposing force to the movement of this object.
      Parameters:
      linearDamping -
      angularDamping -

    • getLinearDamping

      float getLinearDamping()
      Returns the linear damping of this object.
      Returns:
      the linear damping value for this object

    • getAngularDamping

      float getAngularDamping()
      Returns the angular damping of this object.
      Returns:
      the angular dampling value for this object

    • applyForce

      void applyForce(float fx, float fy, float fz, float px, float py, float pz)
      Applies a force with the force vector (fx, fy, fz) at local position (px, py, pz). For example, applyForce(0,10,0,0,0,0) will apply a force of 10 in the Y direction in the local center of the object.
      Parameters:
      fx - the X component of the force vector
      fy - the Y component of the force vector
      fz - the Z component of the force vector
      px - the X component of the local position
      py - the Y component of the local position
      pz - the Z component of the local position

    • applyTorque

      void applyTorque(float fx, float fy, float fz)
      Applies a torque on the object. The torque vector direction defines the axis the objects force will be applied to and the magnitude of the vector defines the actual amount of torque. For example, applyTorque(0,50,0) will cause the object to spin with a force of 50 around the vector pointed in the Y direction using the right-handed rule.
      Parameters:
      fx - the X component of the torque vector
      fy - the Y component of the torque vector
      fz - the Z component of the torque vector
